definition: special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end

sentences.english: In computing, the processing of low priority jobs.
sentences.chinese: 技術中，特指對低優先級作業進行的處理方法。

sentences.english: I had no one in particular in mind when I sais so.
sentences.chinese: 當我提到這個詞時並沒有特指某個人。

sentences.english: bouquet： refers to a pleasingly sweet typical of a wine or liqueur.
sentences.chinese: 指甜美的香味，特指各種酒散發出的清香。

sentences.english: The invention particularly relates to a distribution method for a ceramic tile.
sentences.chinese: 本發明特指一種陶瓷磚的布料方法。

sentences.english: And the long tail specifically refers to the long tail of the demand curve.
sentences.chinese: 在這裏，長尾文化特指需求曲線中的一種狀態。

sentences.english: The lever device in this paper refers in particular to balance and steelyard.
sentences.chinese: 本文所述槓桿裝置特指權衡器，包括天平和桿秤。

sentences.english: Signaling, in economic jargon, means expenditures of time or money whose purpose is to convince others of something.
sentences.chinese: 信號在經濟學中特指爲取信他人所花費的時間或金錢。

sentences.english: That particular reform will be politically contentious.
sentences.chinese: 那種特指的改革將是在政治上具有爭議的。

sentences.english: The present invention relates to printing machine, and is especially a kind of intaglio proofing press.
sentences.chinese: 本發明涉及印刷機械技術領域，特指一種凹版打樣機。

sentences.english: To Pat or squeeze fondly or playfully, especially under the chin.
sentences.chinese: 天真或頑皮地輕拍或壓擠，特指拍下巴。

sentences.english: Legs of especially alaska king crabs.
sentences.chinese: 特指阿拉斯加螃蟹王的腿。

definition: to make a general reference/to be used in a general sense
to be collectively called/collective term/general designation
to refer to/to be used in place of
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
alternative name/to refer to sth by another name/antonomasia
